metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37454 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Keccak XKCP SHA-3 reference implementation before fdc6fef has aninteger overflow and resultant buffer overflow that allows attackers toexecute arbitrary code or eliminate expected cryptographic properties. Thisoccurs in the sponge function interface.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.8
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.8

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.8').
pypy3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.3.9+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
pysha3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2-4.2ubuntu0.22.04.1').
python3.10 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.6-1~22.04.2').
